page.title: 06Woodchurch in the Past
page.content: Children went to{school}in the morning. They had very little equipment and few books. They had air raid shelter practices every week. They took sandwiches for lunch. For punishment, they had the cane. They had no uniform, but the girls wore pinafores to protect their dresses, tall button up boots and straw hats. All boys wore caps. On 1st May, they danced around the Maypole. People{travelled}by horse and cart or bicycle. If you were less lucky, you walked. Children{played}with china dolls and wooden train sets. {Houses}were heated by open fires. People listened to gramophones. In Winter, children went to sunday school in the morning, afternoon and evening, but they only went in the evening in the Summer.
